context.p: When you assign a property group to a route, you can provide values for custom properties that are specific to the route. For example, if the route is for assembling a motor, you can provide the assembly line number, types of motors that are normally assembled on the line, and other details specific to the route.
You can assign a property group to a route or an operation.

taskbody.prereq: Ensure that the property group and underlying properties have been defined in the Property Definition module. For more information, refer to Property Definition.

step.cmd: In the Route Management page, select the route to which you want to assign a property group.

step.stepresult: A list of property groups assigned to the route appears.

step.cmd: If you want to assign a property group to an operation, select the operation. If you want to assign a property group to the route, select ALL OPERATIONS.

step.stepresult: The Assign Property Group(s) window appears.

step.cmd: Select the check boxes corresponding to the property groups that you want to assign.

info.note: If you want to assign all the property groups, select the check box in the heading.

taskbody.result: The selected property groups are assigned to the route or operation. By default, the latest version of each property is assigned to the route or operation. If you want to assign an earlier version, select in the ACTIONS column, and then select the version that you want to assign.
taskbody.postreq: Provide values for each property in the group.
